result.execSummary:
The defendant Travian L Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant shall pay all outstanding GPS fees due to the Racine County Alternatives Program.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent including cognitive intervention. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant Travian L Gardner in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Victim notification accomplished.  State requests adjournment of plea until after 09/27.  Defendant is witness in another case.  State will not oppose release from house arrest to allow for job  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, BRC (person, property, residence or family).   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court, meeting w/his Atty and appointments w/the SAIL program.   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
AMENDED 09/02/16    DEFENDANT MAY BE RELEASED FROM HOUSE ARREST, WITH PRIOR NOTICE TO MONITORING AGENCY, OF JOB INTERVIEWS AND EMPLOYMENT, IF OBTAINED.  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FORCE.
Plea hearing on September 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
